channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Hidden Schema Networks
item.description: Starting from the assumption that a large proportion of semantic content is necessarily relational, we introduce a neural language model that discovers networks of symbols (schemata) from text datasets.

item.title: Mining Discriminative Food Regions for Accurate Food Recognition
item.description: Taking inspiration from Adversarial Erasing, a strategy that progressively discovers discriminative object regions for weakly supervised semantic segmentation, we propose a novel network architecture in which a primary network maintains the base accuracy of classifying an input image, an auxiliary network adversarially mines discriminative food regions, and a region network classifies the resulting mined regions.

item.title: Neural Implicit Dictionary via Mixture-of-Expert Training
item.description: In this paper, we present a generic INR framework that achieves both data and training efficiency by learning a Neural Implicit Dictionary (NID) from a data collection and representing INR as a functional combination of basis sampled from the dictionary.

item.title: Learning High-quality Proposals for Acne Detection
item.description: Acne detection is crucial for interpretative diagnosis and precise treatment of skin disease.

item.title: An Efficiency Study for SPLADE Models
item.description: SPLADE efficiency can be controlled via a regularization factor, but solely controlling this regularization has been shown to not be efficient enough.

item.title: Crake: Causal-Enhanced Table-Filler for Question Answering over Large Scale Knowledge Base
item.description: Semantic parsing solves knowledge base (KB) question answering (KBQA) by composing a KB query, which generally involves node extraction (NE) and graph composition (GC) to detect and connect related nodes in a query.

item.title: Deep Learning for Anomaly Detection in Log Data: A Survey
item.description: Automatic log file analysis enables early detection of relevant incidents such as system failures.

item.title: ControlBurn: Nonlinear Feature Selection with Sparse Tree Ensembles
item.description: ControlBurn is a Python package to construct feature-sparse tree ensembles that support nonlinear feature selection and interpretable machine learning.

item.title: A Non-isotropic Probabilistic Take on Proxy-based Deep Metric Learning
item.description: We model images as directional von Mises-Fisher (vMF) distributions on the hypersphere that can reflect image-intrinsic uncertainties.

item.title: The Harvard USPTO Patent Dataset: A Large-Scale, Well-Structured, and Multi-Purpose Corpus of Patent Applications
item.description: Innovation is a major driver of economic and social development, and information about many kinds of innovation is embedded in semi-structured data from patents and patent applications.

item.title: SuperTickets: Drawing Task-Agnostic Lottery Tickets from Supernets via Jointly Architecture Searching and Parameter Pruning
item.description: In this paper, we discover for the first time that both efficient DNNs and their lottery subnetworks (i. e., lottery tickets) can be directly identified from a supernet, which we term as SuperTickets, via a two-in-one training scheme with jointly architecture searching and parameter pruning.

item.title: Generalization-Memorization Machines
item.description: Under this mechanism, error-based learning machines improve their memorization abilities of training data without over-fitting.

item.title: Video Dialog as Conversation about Objects Living in Space-Time
item.description: To tackle these challenges we present a new object-centric framework for video dialog that supports neural reasoning dubbed COST - which stands for Conversation about Objects in Space-Time.

item.title: Reinforced Lin-Kernighan-Helsgaun Algorithms for the Traveling Salesman Problems
item.description: The Lin-Kernighan-Helsgaun (LKH) algorithm is one of the state-of-the-art local search algorithms for the TSP, and LKH-3 is a powerful extension of LKH that can solve many TSP variants.

item.title: SETSum: Summarization and Visualization of Student Evaluations of Teaching
item.description: Ten university professors from diverse departments serve as evaluators of the system and all agree that SETSum helps them interpret SET results more efficiently; and 6 out of 10 instructors prefer our system over the standard static PDF report (while the remaining 4 would like to have both).

item.title: Memory-free Online Change-point Detection: A Novel Neural Network Approach
item.description: We show that ALACPD, on average, ranks first among state-of-the-art CPD algorithms in terms of quality of the time series segmentation, and it is on par with the best performer in terms of the accuracy of the estimated change-points.

item.title: Bounding Box Disparity: 3D Metrics for Object Detection With Full Degree of Freedom
item.description: The most popular evaluation metric for object detection in 2D images is Intersection over Union (IoU).

item.title: Learning Sequential Descriptors for Sequence-based Visual Place Recognition
item.description: In robotics, Visual Place Recognition is a continuous process that receives as input a video stream to produce a hypothesis of the robot's current position within a map of known places.

item.title: TGRMPT: A Head-Shoulder Aided Multi-Person Tracker and a New Large-Scale Dataset for Tour-Guide Robot
item.description: A service robot serving safely and politely needs to track the surrounding people robustly, especially for Tour-Guide Robot (TGR).

item.title: Reproducing sensory induced hallucinations via neural fields
item.description: In this work, we focus on pattern formation in the visual cortex when the cortical activity is driven by a geometric visual hallucination-like stimulus.

item.title: Detection of Furigana Text in Images
item.description: This project focuses on detecting furigana in Japanese books and comics.

item.title: k-means Mask Transformer
item.description: However, we observe that most existing transformer-based vision models simply borrow the idea from NLP, neglecting the crucial difference between languages and images, particularly the extremely large sequence length of spatially flattened pixel features.

item.title: A Multi-tasking Model of Speaker-Keyword Classification for Keeping Human in the Loop of Drone-assisted Inspection
item.description: A base model for a group of five authorized subjects is trained and tested on the inspection keyword dataset collected by this study.

item.title: Variational Inference of overparameterized Bayesian Neural Networks: a theoretical and empirical study
item.description: This paper studies the Variational Inference (VI) used for training Bayesian Neural Networks (BNN) in the overparameterized regime, i. e., when the number of neurons tends to infinity.

item.title: GT4SD: Generative Toolkit for Scientific Discovery
item.description: With the growing availability of data within various scientific domains, generative models hold enormous potential to accelerate scientific discovery at every step of the scientific method.

item.title: Revisiting Pretraining Objectives for Tabular Deep Learning
item.description: Recent deep learning models for tabular data currently compete with the traditional ML models based on decision trees (GBDT).

item.title: A unified interpretable intelligent learning diagnosis framework for smart education
item.description: Intelligent learning diagnosis is a critical engine of smart education, which aims to estimate learners' current knowledge mastery status and predict their future learning performance.

item.title: Do We Really Need Inertia?
item.description: The emphasis on inertia for system stability has been a long-held tradition in conventional grids.

item.title: A Large Scale Search Dataset for Unbiased Learning to Rank
item.description: The unbiased learning to rank (ULTR) problem has been greatly advanced by recent deep learning techniques and well-designed debias algorithms.

item.title: Neural Stein critics with staged $L^2$-regularization
item.description: Theoretically, we relate the training dynamic with large regularization weight to the kernel regression optimization of "lazy training" regime in early training times.

item.title: One for All: Simultaneous Metric and Preference Learning over Multiple Users
item.description: This paper investigates simultaneous preference and metric learning from a crowd of respondents.

item.title: ExpansionNet: exploring the sequence length bottleneck in the Transformer for Image Captioning
item.description: Most recent state of art architectures rely on combinations and variations of three approaches: convolutional, recurrent and self-attentive methods.

item.title: The ACII 2022 Affective Vocal Bursts Workshop & Competition: Understanding a critically understudied modality of emotional expression
item.description: The ACII Affective Vocal Bursts Workshop & Competition is focused on understanding multiple affective dimensions of vocal bursts: laughs, gasps, cries, screams, and many other non-linguistic vocalizations central to the expression of emotion and to human communication more generally.

item.title: VeriDark: A Large-Scale Benchmark for Authorship Verification on the Dark Web
item.description: The DarkWeb represents a hotbed for illicit activity, where users communicate on different market forums in order to exchange goods and services.

item.title: TFCNs: A CNN-Transformer Hybrid Network for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Medical image segmentation is one of the most fundamental tasks concerning medical information analysis.

item.title: Deep Rotation Correction without Angle Prior
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new and practical task, named Rotation Correction, to automatically correct the tilt with high content fidelity in the condition that the rotated angle is unknown.

item.title: The DynaSig-ML Python package: automated learning of biomolecular dynamics-function relationships
item.description: Summary: The DynaSig-ML (Dynamical Signatures - Machine Learning) Python package allows the efficient, user-friendly exploration of 3D dynamics-function relationships in biomolecules, using datasets of experimental measures from large numbers of sequence variants.

item.title: Contrastive Learning from Spatio-Temporal Mixed Skeleton Sequences for Self-Supervised Skeleton-Based Action Recognition
item.description: First, SkeleMix utilizes the topological information of skeleton data to mix two skeleton sequences by randomly combing the cropped skeleton fragments (the trimmed view) with the remaining skeleton sequences (the truncated view).

item.title: Dual-Stream Transformer for Generic Event Boundary Captioning
item.description: This paper describes our champion solution for the CVPR2022 Generic Event Boundary Captioning (GEBC) competition.

item.title: Stochastic optimal well control in subsurface reservoirs using reinforcement learning
item.description: For this problem, the system is partially observed since the data is only available at well locations.

item.title: Inferring Structural Parameters of Low-Surface-Brightness-Galaxies with Uncertainty Quantification using Bayesian Neural Networks
item.description: Measuring the structural parameters (size, total brightness, light concentration, etc.)

item.title: Robust optimal well control using an adaptive multi-grid reinforcement learning framework
item.description: RL control policies are initially learned using computationally efficient low fidelity simulations using coarse grid discretization of the underlying partial differential equations (PDEs).

item.title: SC2EGSet: StarCraft II Esport Replay and Game-state Dataset
item.description: Based on initial investigation of available StarCraft II datasets, we observed that our dataset is the largest publicly available source of StarCraft II esports data upon its publication.

item.title: Bridging the Gap between Object and Image-level Representations for Open-Vocabulary Detection
item.description: Two popular forms of weak-supervision used in open-vocabulary detection (OVD) include pretrained CLIP model and image-level supervision.

item.title: MCTS with Refinement for Proposals Selection Games in Scene Understanding
item.description: We also introduce a novel differentiable method for rendering the polygonal shapes of these proposals.

item.title: HierarchicalForecast: A Python Benchmarking Framework for Hierarchical Forecasting
item.description: Large collections of time series data are commonly organized into cross-sectional structures with different levels of aggregation; examples include product and geographical groupings.

item.title: Dual Stream Computer-Generated Image Detection Network Based On Channel Joint And Softpool
item.description: The proposed network architecture includes a residual module for extracting image noise information and a joint channel information extraction module for capturing the shallow semantic information of image.

item.title: D2HNet: Joint Denoising and Deblurring with Hierarchical Network for Robust Night Image Restoration
item.description: Night imaging with modern smartphone cameras is troublesome due to low photon count and unavoidable noise in the imaging system.

item.title: An Additive Instance-Wise Approach to Multi-class Model Interpretation
item.description: Interpretable machine learning offers insights into what factors drive a certain prediction of a black-box system and whether to trust it for high-stakes decisions or large-scale deployment.

item.title: BibleTTS: a large, high-fidelity, multilingual, and uniquely African speech corpus
item.description: BibleTTS is a large, high-quality, open speech dataset for ten languages spoken in Sub-Saharan Africa.
